content: Wait, your BOYFRIEND wanted a new sofa and she gave YOU the credit card and told you to pick it out and that YOU would pay her back? Time for some boundary setting! For real. For serious. Owing money to family is never a good idea, even if you can pay them back, and the sofa thing is setting a bad precedent. Nip this in the bud and work on delayed gratification for things that aren’t necessary. She may mean this as a “kind” thing, but it’s also a control thing, in the end.
